sections.name: Wight Cultist
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 34

link.alt: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 34

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don't benefit from healing effects.

link.name: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 34
link.alt: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 34

gear.name: platinum religious symbol of Bokrug worth 150 gp

automatic_abilities.name: Dreadful Spite
automatic_abilities.trigger: The wight cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points
automatic_abilities.effect: The wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. It doesn't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike. A creature hit by this Strike is also doomed 1 for 1 minute.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don't have a free hand. This uses the weapon's reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon's item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Drain Life

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

ability.text: When the wight damages a living creature with its claw or *ranseur* Strike, the wight gains 12 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or become drained 1. Further damage dealt by the wight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

ability.name: Wight Spawn

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

ability.text: A living humanoid slain by a wight's claw or *ranseur* Strike rises as a wight after 1d4 rounds. This wight spawn is under the command of the wight that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wight spawn and becomes clumsy 2 for as long as it is a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains drain life and wight spawn, and is no longer clumsy
